Review Text: I was very impressed with Leola. I searched for top-rated hotels in Ikeja area and it came up. The name did not impress me, but the pictures did. Then what I met there impressed me further.  The place is neat. Bathroom is clean. The only minus in my shower is the white silicone at the corners of the shower. It could have been done better, or use grey cement for perfection. I like the comfort of the place.

I was pleasantly surprised with the positive staff attitude, amenities available in the hotel and tasty meals all available at a fantastic rate. I was able to check early as t no extra cost. Rooms are large enough and location is very quiet. I will stay again. Breakfast was very good.

Had an amazing stay. Everything worked great. Mini pool and mini gym to complement it. Breakfast was tasty with a decent variety. Although I had a nasty experience where I ordered for dinner, a spaghetti bolognese meal, where the meat was rotten :-( any cook can tell if food has gone bad but for it to have been served to me, made me question the food in store and played it safe by eating elsewhere after that experience. Aside that Wifi worked well. The frequent power cuts were not felt as a generator kicked in a few seconds after the mains went off. Overall I Enjoyed my stay but very disturbed by the food experience. May be a one-off but just be mindful

Friendly staff, clean room, ok beds and delicate bathroom. Small but nice pool area. Restaurant ok but breakfast bare minimum. Security guards outside and inside and guarded gate. Air con in meeting room was very variable but ok in the sleeping room. I think it depend on where the room is in the air con loop.

Very good hotel stuff and good behaviour. Room size is quite good and food is excellent!  Relatively small pool but cozy environment.  There is parking lot available, good location, gym is also well maintained.

Review Title: Breakfast pastries tasted like they were made just for you
Review Text: Let me start by raving about the breakfast pastries (croissant, banana bread, scone and pain aux raisins). All wonderfully delicate and fresh. They seemed to have been prepared by someone's mom who also happens to be an expert chef, wanting to send her children into the day with a special "I love you".  The art in the reception area created a great environment. Definitely worthwhile to linger and admire.  The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Lots of attention to detail and they made you feel very welcome.

This hotel exceeded all my expectations. I have been coming to Lagos for 15 years, and for the first time felt "at Home"! Great spacious rooms, excellent Wi-Fi, great TV Channels, awesome food. Loved the nice big towels too! And there is an ATM on the premises, which is most appreciated, and I no longer have to stand in a queue in the heat and sun  to draw money.

I've stayed here 4 times now and very convenient for the airport. Room are spacious with excellent, quality bathrooms and all fittings work perfectly. Food and beverage very good especially the breakfast. Service very good and friendly. Very secure

I know this hotel from the old days, as it used to be a Protea Hotel. After 5 years I went back. The rooms are renovated. Some staff is still the same. The hotel is very nice, small and the new GM Jacques is doing a good job. The food is still good. We gave some inputs to enlarge the menu. I would like to see a Chenin Blanc in the wine list. We can recommend the hotel and will come back. It is a perfect place wot work out in Ikeja.

Review Title: Best Internet I have encountered in Nigeria, Amazing Food and Guaranteed good night sleep
Review Text: L'eola impresses me more everytime I spend time here. The 3 nights spent here did not serve up any dull moments. The internet is so fast and reliable, I just settle in and watch my series on Netflix. The food options are also impressive and leave me looking forward to dinner time. As for sleep, the pillows are super soft and the bed so comfortable. The only concern I had was with the water pressure up on the second floor, and I like the speed with which the maintenance guy was dispatched to come and fix it. It didn't flow that much faster but at least they get points for efforts
Review Text

Have been looking for a not overcrowded and nice hotel close to the airport. L'eola is perfetcly located, especially if you have some meetings in the evening in Ikeja area. Rooms are clean and stylish, breakfast is tasty and staff is very helpful. Internet speed is good enough to link up via VPN to work servers. Fully recommended for business travelers.

Have been struggling to find reasonable accommodation near to the airport and this has come out well. First stay for one night. Spacious room with everything working. Nice layout. Food was also good. Had two meals. Pool looked nice but didnt have time to take advantage of it.

Review Title: Change of name, brand is even better
Review Text: The hotel (formerly known as Protea Leadway) and very much still a part of the Leadway groups had actually stepped up from the last time I visited. The food is still great and the quality of sleep is rated high. There's also high speed internet and an ATM in the lobby. Complimentary breakfast with lots of TV stations to choose from. The location of the hotel is also a big plus as the Airport can easily be accessed from the Hotel and for someone who needs to transact business on the mainland or even quickly link up with the Island, this is value for money. A shower curtain has also been put at the entrance of the bathroom which provides some feeling of privacy and means that families with children can consider the hotel. A door would ultimately see the rating go up to 5/5

Review Title: Hospitality meets friendly...what a powerful combination!
Review Text: This is a hidden gem. The welcome is indicative of the warm and friendly personality of the entire team at this hotel. Their attention to detail is meticulous and they are always there when you need them, and they are not there when they are not needed. What a breath of fresh air to be in such a professionally managed hotel that is small enough to personalise their service and yet big enough to have all the amenities of a big hotel. Well done to the team that manages and works at this hotel.

My wife and I and some friends had our end of year retreat here and we had an awesome time. We were so happy, we referred a few people. All feedback was positive. Looking forward to our 2018 end of year retreat!

The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were modern and comfortable and the food in the restaurant was absolutely great. This was always a nice hotel to stay in Lagos, but with the refurbishment they really up'd their game.

Must compliment this Hotel on itâ€™s renovations. Every thing is in perfect order. Great Management, great staff. Love the atmosphere here.  If you are traveling to Lagos, or just looking for a great meal, I would recommend this Hotel.

So glad this hotel has been renovated and rebranded from previous protea. Rooms are spotless, staff friendly, food is top notch.. All unnecessary decors of before removed, its so bright and very sparkly. Weldone guys. Good job

Came for a quick trip to Nigeria; glad to have had my first hotel stay in Nigeria at Leadway. I was impressed with the professional and courteous staff; the facility felt secure, which was important for me; and the room was comfortable--good for a solo traveler.   An area of improvement: the internet service was quite poor, so I'd hesitate to recommend it for business travelers who depend heavily on fast/reliable connections.

Watching the lights in the pool change while taking a drink and trying to think is actually quite calming!  I love the design of the rooms. However, the bathroom lights were all out. The food was quite ok as well.
Review Text

It is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and both times I have been impressed. Great rooms/bathroom, Very clean and excellent service. Food quality and beverage service equally as good. Very convenient for airport

I was here in October 2016. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The staff were very helpful but the following staff were outstanding; Shade, Blessings and Prince. It was an emotional moment when i had to check out because the company booked a different hotel. Shade almost shade tears. This was touching. I enjoyed the breakfast. They have a variety

I had a good experience with my stay at leadway. The room was more than comfortable, everything worked as it should. Service was excellent. Food was good although I would have liked a wider choice on the menu. The desk was very helpfull and efficient at arrival and departure Thank you for the stay.

Review Title: A comfortable and secure stay in Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed in this hotel on several occasions for business and have always found it to be a good choice. Rooms are comfortable and large with a great bathroom and storage for clothing. Rooms also have their own desk and phone for working which is great. The lounge area is comfortable with a range of sofas chairs and dining tables and the food is good. The menu has some Nigerian food dishes as well as Italian options (pasta and pizza) and some healthy options like salmon and chicken. After multiple stays, the menu does (as with anywhere) start to get a little repetitive but I only felt this way on my 5th stay. One suggestion I would have is for Leadway Hotel to add more options for starters or light options for lunch as well as more vegetarian options in general. The hotel

I once again visited Laos and stayed at Leadway Hotel. The staff are very professional and helpful. The GM Dean is always on the floor tendering to your every need. The giant prawns are delicious and are a tradition everytime I visit Lagos. Many tourists visiting the hotel, seems like I am back at home in SA. Well done Dean to you and you Team keep up the great work.

Review Title: An island in the middle of a very busy city!
Review Text: The hotel is relatively close to the airport, which is a major plus considering the traffic conditions in Nairobi!! The hotel is small but very cosy, the rooms are nicely decorated and have a wonderful open bathroom (room and bathroom were separated only by a curtain). The small but nice outdoor swimmingpool is a perfect place to relax (a little bit small if you want to swim). The gym is also small (but it's ok; as the hotel is having only a few rooms) but has a new trademill and stepper as well as some machines and free weights. Noteworthy is the quality and attention of the service! Entering the hotel you feel on a "peace island" in the middle of a very busy city!

A.c didnt not work all night! They kept pretending to fix it and gave excuses in the morning. They couldnt change the room for whatever reasons &  I kept complaining but nothing was done. It was a very hot and uncomfortable stay.  Very bad value for Money!

All good but internet is a bit slow and not strong enough to reach all the rooms other than that the service is perfect and the people are nice and ,they r so happy people and doing their job happy and smiley and welcoming us and they always want to help which is very good to see that to feel we want to come again

The staff here is very helpful.Courteous everytime I asked them anything.I loved the tiger prawns here.Its a must try. I wouldn't give excellent as the wifi here is not good enough.It always goes on and off .Thats a bit of a hastle.I still will would want to come back as I like the city.Would encourage the  hotel to arrange city tours which gives the crew the confidence to enjoy the city

My room was very comfortable. Felt at home . The breakfast buffet was amazing. Also the dinner menu awesome. Hotel is in close proximity to shopping and restaurants. Pool was nice. The gym has sufficient equipment
Review Text

Love the people and staff excellent service, diffenently coming. p.s internet is so so ðŸ˜©  Nice pool. If you want to check out the mall it's only 15 away without traffic and 45 min with.   No extra charge if you get a visiter outside the hotel.
Author Location: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Review Text: Stayed for 3 days and it was a pleasant experience. Super friendly staff ready to serve you at the highest standard. If you are stopping by Lagos I would highly recommend this hotel. Clean room, nice small swimming pool...

Review Title: Relaxing stay at Leadway hotel, Nigeria
Review Text: Once arriving at the hotel a concierge will meet you and assist with luggage. Check in staff are friendly and willing to assist with any questions you might have regarding facilities offered. Beautiful open plan rooms with great amenities. Pool area is great to relax and soak up the sun during your stay.

The rooms are spacious and clean. The location is excellent for my business, centrally located. The staff are very friendly and motivated to help guests. The service is prompt and the rate is just right. My kids love the food and ambience of the environment.

Review Title: Warm staffs and an amazing environment
Review Text: Stayed here during my visit to Lagos..greeted with amazing people and hotel itself is spotless.very clean with amazing food. I'll be sure to come back here on my next visit to Lagos. Pool and gym is enough for my trip.

My first time in Nigiria Lagos, Nothing much to say , such a wonderful experience , thank u all staff members of the hotel for everything. Well recommended and looking forward to come back again .... Love the food especially the Salmon Spinach and the lovely Hunters Dry drink Must try .... Saluuuuuuuud

Had a relaxed and lovely stay at Leadway Hotel. The staff are extremely friendly and go out there way to make your stay enjoyable. The hotel has a lovely outside area with a pool , as well as a small restaurants which serves great food. Look forward to coming back again.

The hotel is really peaceful, the hotel staff is really warm and friendly. The area around the swimming pool is peaceful and quiet. Room are cosy especially the pillows. I have really enjoyed my short stay.

This is one of the best hotels in Lagos.  It is close to the airport, so avoid the horrible traffic getting to the island.  Staff are always friendly and attentive.  Comfortable and relaxed atmosphere.  It is a sanctuary. Rooms are clean and linen is clean every day.  Nothing is too much trouble. Always stay there.  Stayed there in excess of 50 times, and will be back.

The hotel staff are very friendly and easy to find should you need anything. There is one small restaurant which serves great food. The room was lovely and the bathroom looks beautiful. Also a nice pool area which catches the sun. Had a wonderful stay.
Author Location: Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

Review Text: Review Text

My 2 days lay over in Leadway hotel was really nice the warm welcome at the entrance directly made me feel comfortable, I loved the design of the bathroom in my room, the staff is very nice and cheerful, I'm already looking forward to coming back to this lovely hotel

Overall good. Clean rooms, good pool, Rooms likely require refurbishment. Dinner good, breakfast good. Location close to airport thus convenient for overnight stay but far from central city if going for business

Stayed at the Leadway for our pre honeymoon.it was the perfect beginning.very relaxing and peaceful away from the chaos.would definitely revisit and stay here.Staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were immaculate and comfortable.

The room is nicely decorated and you feel a cosy atmosphere. Shower worked very well, amenities are provided that you need, even slippers.    Food is well prepared and you can eat at the restaurant or by the pool.  The pool area is very nice and the perfect place to relax after a flight.    The staff is amazing, alas friendly and smiling.

This is a Protea (unless a changeover has happened in the last 3 months). Modern rooms, dont look too hard otherwise you will see some detail issues, e.g. uneven skirting boards, nails poking out, bit for a Lagos hotel its a great one.  Breakfast is the best in Nigeria and the staff are great.  you also get a name placard on the wall when you come to welcome you!  jollof rice here is delicious, beds comfy. wosh the would give 2 litres of water in the room not just one and the rooms are on the smaller side

I had the Leadway salad  it was amazing and big one. Good serivce from the resturant   staff always smelling also I love the bath walls it was made with bricks. Everyone in The hotel can go extra  way to assist you with whatever you want.

Room was very nice, food was amazing. Nice pool, gym open 24 hours, perfect service and very nice staff. I came only for 24 hours which is a very short stay but it was a very nice stay and nice experiwence.

Review Title: Hotel review amazing food and a lot of security
Review Text: Cozy hotel with a lot of security and friendly  and very polite staff. Food is excellent especially the seafood part and the Tiger Prawns getting the 5 stars!  The bed is really comfortable with a medium size room, the bathroom is separated just by a curtain.  The pool and social area are nice as well with lounge music playing... The decor of the library in the lobby along with a computer for public use makes it different and unique.

Truly a welcoming experience, the staff are always available and are eager to offer help and good humor! Highly recommend this hotel! The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious, as well as having the usual amenities available.

Good food,  cold beer super polite and friendly staff, friendly and large rooms.  Love to meet the great people who stay here. Thanks Dean to you and your great team. It has the feel and ambience of a boutique hotel.  It is one of very few hotels where one looks forward to repeat visits. And staff remember your name regardless of time between stays.
Review Text

Review Title: Small but a surprise of a place
Review Text: Very friendly and helpful staff ... Hotel may be small but very tastefully done ... Always stayed at Sheraton and Protea Ikeja before but this one is on my list for the next stay too Pool may be small but adequate... Location is a bit iffy but hotel staff and decor gives the warmth to the guest

What an awesome place to stay when staying in Lagos, hotel is clean staff and management are always happy to assist. Food is really really good and affordable. Close to the airport making traveling easy. My number one choice of hotels in lagos.

The hotel is small, but i like the fact that all the hotel facilities are located very close to each other. The room itself was quite tidy and clean. Regarding the food i would say that it was very delicious, even though a bit spicy for me, and the portions were huge! And of course the personel is very friendly and helpful

The stuff are super nice. Rarely u can see such hospitable crew. I appreciate a lot their service. Inspire of the fact that internet or electricity goes down sometimes, these people made their best so I enjoy my stay.  The food is yummi. Rooms are nice n clean.  Bravo!  :*

The hotel is a small boutique property, elegant and quiet whose staff can't do enough to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable.Rooms are beautifully furnished and clean. The quality overall was excellent (I LOVED the bathroom fixtures), and everything was clean and spotless. The bed linens after a long flight were an absolute delight. Pure comfort and great amenities. The breakfast was excellent with a wide selection of hot and cold offerings .Enjoyed the time spend by the pool on the beautiful terrace .The ride to and from the airport worked out great. Highly recommended!!!!!!

Lagos generally has a price / quality problem, where to get anything decent you pay a fortune and then still find issues. On a recommendation from some cabin crew I tried Protea Leadway and what a pleasant surprise. The rooms were above average, had all the facilities, good a/c, good water temp and pressure, nice beds, clean towels etc and a decent wifi service. What really set it apart was the staff. Big ups to the management for the training done, every staff member was polite, greeted me with a smile and seemed genuinely pleased to help - what a pleasure for Lagos.  The airport collection was easy to find and on time, check in was done by name and was very efficient and the breakfast service was a highlight - a good, comprehensive, fresh choice of food. Dinner was more of the

The hotel was actually up to standard. I give it a solid B. So I'd stay again biggest put off was the smell of smoking coming from someone's room. The outside is a little deceiving but the inside is up to your the US Courtyard Marriott standard. The only real big issue with this hotel is the cost of the hotel. If it was ~$75-85 less it would get 5 stars. At their rate id expect a Hyatt Regency type hotel.  But for Lagos I will say it's good, strong B grading. Maybe some perks they can add is free hotel pick up and drop off and local rate for food for hotel guest. This would make it an A hotel.   Pro:  Staff awesome (A+) Bed is decent (B+) Shower works good (A+) Sink works good (A+) Pool is nice Gym is small but seems functional  Cons: Smoking rooms near nonsmoking rooms; greater

Review Title: Wonderful Place, excellent staff, very comfortable rooms
Review Text: This is a mid-sized hotel which shouldn't be compared with the huge chains. However, it is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are cosy, very well designed. The staff are extraordinarily helpful.  The gym is small (probably get around 4 people in it at a time). The pool is 'OK' not very big, so if this is a big issue, look elsewhere.  There is free wifi throughout the hotel. Unlike other places it does seem to hold up (and not keep disconnecting). The food is decent  Overall a very satisfactory experience!

This is my second trip back to the property this year and it was so nice to be greeted by friendly staff who remembered my name. Since it was my second trip I noticed things differently this time. The location is an ideal distance from the Airport--not too close and not too far away. Additionally, we made a trip to the Island and it seemed easy for my driver to get to.   The breakfast buffet is really good and the ambience is comparable to some of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in the USA.  This trip I had a meeting with a tribal ruler from another state who seemed more than happy to join me at this property with his entourage. They were taking many selfies by the beautiful pool deck and seemed impressed.  I always appreciate the security personnel as well. Never felt in any

The interiors are great, the bed is really cozy, the bathrooms are nice and clean. Most of the staff are helpful and customer friendly.   The food is not all that great and as a vegetarian, no much options available.   I'd ordered food to the room & after tasting the food, I realized, it wasn't well made and lodged a complaint. The gentleman said, he would take care of it. While checking out I was billed for it. The duty manager was more keen on attending to new guests than attend to my complaint. Waited for sometime to get the issue resolved, finally I paid up for the bills and rushed, to get to the airport on time.   I liked the hotel but this incident put me off.
Review Text

It's often difficult travelling to Lagos , Nigeria. Getting from the Airport to your hotel and finding a welcome haven to start your business trip. Dean and his team at the Protea Leadway , took care of all of those concerns. We were met at the Airport, ferried quickly to the hotel and there met by his efficient team. check in was seamless and in no time at all , we were enjoying a quite beer in the lounge ! What a pleasure ! Thanks to Dean and the team !

This is the second time I have stayed at the Leadway Protea Hotel and it was wonderful. Close to the Airport. You cannot believe that you in Lagos when you sitting in the lounge, it reminds me of when I am sitting in a hotel in South Africa. The GM Dean was very accommodating making sure that your every need is taken care of. The chef Wayne is always willing to bend over backwards for you in the kitchen with his culinary skills. A home away from home. A great hotel, great service, clean and safe. Keep up the great service. I can recommend the Leadway Hotel to anyone that travels to Lagos.

Review Title: A comfortable stay with great service.
Review Text: This is my favorite hotel in Lagos. It is professional, very clean and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Facilities are well taken care off and management is always available to assist with any queries.

Review Title: The only place to stay when in Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed at many different hotels in and around Nigeria, but the Leadway Protea Hotel in Maryland is the best Hotel I have visited in a long time, regardless of country. The hospitality and professional service is world class. The food is excellent and when I come to Lagos again, this will be the only Hotel for me to stay! Thank you guys for making my trip enjoyable and keep up the great work!

I travel often and this hotel is my choice when I'm in Lagos.Well run hotel. Friendly and professional staff. The social area is always clean and well maintained. Rooms are clean and well equipped. The dÃ©cor ranks up there with the best of them. Staying in hotels is not always about appearances and although it plays a big roll. It's the way the staff attends to the guests. I can honestly say that the staff and management has always made me feel at home.

I liked the hotel it's soo nice I wish to b here again it's feels like home . Nice rooms clean the the stuff are so friendly and open the have fitness centre and a very pool and the prices are so good . There buffet is cool a lot of food . U can relax very well there

Review Title: Excellent place to stay in Lagos
Review Text: Excellent friendly staff. Double bedroom was clean with good layout. Very courteous staff helpful at all times. Excellent air conditioning, bath and shower in very good condition. Restaurant staff courteous. Very good food served for breakfast and dinner. I would recommend the hotel to anybody coming in to Lagos from abroad.

If you want to hide from the hustle and bustle of Lagos, this is the hotel to be. Tucked in a side street off ikeja, the hotel, though medium sized is well designed. I loved the brick wall that separated the bathroom from the main room, I love hotels that pay attention to details and they definitely did with a bar of chocolate waiting on my bed and a personal note with my name on it. The only minus was that the electric socket on the walls was south African, which we don't use in Nigeria. Luckily, I had recently returned from joburg so I used one of the adaptors I bought. I enjoyed every bit of the money I spent for my one night stay.

From pre-arrival to post-departure my team and I were very well-treated in this comfortable, secure, and pleasant environment. We felt very valued and this property has become our "go-to" hotel in Lagos from here on out.

Review Title: general review of the place and service
Review Text: The hotel is rather small but cozy. The staff is very kind and friendly. Always ready to assist in a professional manner. ( Kingsley was very nice, approachable, smiley and easy to talk to. He has demonstrated a very good customer service) I recommend this hotel who look for a intimate atmosphere .  Ps.The place is very safe.
Review Text

In over 25 years of my traveling experience I can say, I have seen most of it. This hotel was booked for me by 3rd party and I did not have any expectation whatsoever. But I must say, beyond my dreams I was surprised in positive way. Room was excellent, equipped both with shower and bath tub. Whole room was nice and clean. Restaurant works late in the night and opens 5 AM so if you need to go for early flight you are still able to have some food before you leave. Wi-Fi was actually available as they said so, all around. If I must to point at something, this would be service in restaurant, I came late and there was not so many people at all, but service was slow, though food was nice. I will definetelly recommend this hotel to everyone coming to Lagos

I agree with the consensus sentiment: this hotel generally exceeds expectations. It's not a five-star, to be sure, but the facilities are surprisingly good. The standard King I stayed in was clean and well laid out. The location, for a business hotel, was good: close to the airport in busy Ikeja but nestled in a quiet street off the main road. But first you have to make it past the front desk, and be advised to hold on to your wallet!   In the worst Nigerian fashion (I am Nigerian, by the way) the front desk staff attempted to profit off me. At check-in on late evening of Apr 16, they tried to renounce a confirmed booking I made on a third-party website, claiming they were fully booked -- even though I'd called an hour prior to arrival to confirm availability. When I resolutely

Overall my experians and stay at protea leadway has been an delight and will recommend other trafelars to  stay over at this hotel , at any time you will be received with an friendly face , and assisted withe any request . The services is good withe grate food . I will advise trafelars to enjoy the comfort of protea hotel ( leadway )

I travel frequently on business, necessity dictates that often it is to stressful locations. When I am in Lagos it is comforting to be greeted with a smile (sometimes by name), in a safe, secure environment with all the comforts of home. The Staff are awesome, led by a strong Management team that personally talks to guest. I strongly recommend the Protea Hotel Leadway as a base for your business dealings in Nigeria.

Review Title: I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of attention from staff and management!
Review Text: Employees of our company constantly travel to Lagos and stay at this hotel. Yes you can see it's not a brand new property, but the hardworking and creative staff make up for that big time! As it was our anniversary stay, they organized an amazing party with barbecue, Nigerian style performance and goody bags which made this hotel unforgettable for us! The general manager is very approachable and spends a lot of time with the guests, and the other staff are extremely friendly, genuine, helpful and ready to go beyond their job responsibilities. Also the poolside area is very nice and cosy. I am definitely looking forward to coming back to this place, big thank you. Maria

very friendly and professional staff who made the stay relaxing and pleasant. attentive to our needs and caring for our comfort. the hotel offer a nice outside pool, the gym is very very small, almost impossible to use it. the food is delicious and well presented. the rooms are big and full selection of tea coffee is offered. definately worth it to try for the hospitality of the staff

Review Title: In need of a deep refurbishnent
Review Text: Maybe this hotel was good when just built. Now it needs heavy work. My room was big but was way run down. I couldnt close the bathroom door. Furniture and bed linens were old. There is a very small pool. Most staff are not friendly aka rude for western standards. Breakfast was a joke, with the smallest selection of food I ever saw in my life.  And the smell in the lobby was awful.

The best thing about this hotel is the Staff. So friendly and approachable at all the time from the minute u arrive till the time u will leave. They will make u feel at home. Nice hotel you will find whatever u need pool, gym and comfortable rooms with lovely bath ;)

This hotel is not far from the Sheraton Hotel, Ikeja. It's in a very secure compound, and inward checks of cars and people is re-assuring. I have stayed here three times.  It's a small hotel, with a small lobby. It's a place to stay if you enjoy quiet and privacy. Its not a place to be loud and be seen. Its all very understated but in a classy way. The rooms are modern, clean, well air-conditioned and never far from the lobby. Service is excellent, and within hours the staff seems to know who you are, and helpful.  The Restaurant is excellent, with a good choice of seafood and meat dishes, all to South African standards. The Tiger Prawns with sesame as starter,  and Ribs or T-bone for mains. The breakfast buffet is huge, and again well presented.  The senior managers are present

A group of friends and myself decided to have breakfast at the hotel this morning. It was excellent. There was not one thing that was missing from the variety. I enjoyed the salmon, it was so fresh. Bacon, chicken livers, a selection of cheeses and imported meats. The staff were excellent, the chef Wayne took the time sit with us and enjoy a cup of coffee. The manager Dean was on top of his game ensuring that we were being looked after. The hotel makes me feel that I am not in Lagos, a nice change. Well done to the Protea Team, keep up the great service.  Regards  Dave
Review Text

On my first time to Nigeria I couldnt have asked for a better place to stay! The Rooms are modern and clean! The tiger prawns at their restaurant are THE BOMB!   Friendly and attentive staff.  Cant wait to be back!

Very cozy hotel! Excellent staff and great food!!!! I definitely recommend Tiger prawns!   I loved them! Hotel is small and does not accommodate a lot of people but it better if u need to relax and want some peace and quite! Would recommend it to everyone!

This was my second stay at the Leadway hotel and it just gets better. On arrival, i was warmly greeted by the porters, the concierge right through to the receptionist staff. Even Dean the general manager came from his office to welcome me. It really felt like i was part of 'the family' for many years even though it was only my second visit. A letter congratulating me on my revisit to the hotel and also an invitation to join the 'guest appreciation' function that the hotel was hosting in the evening was placed in my room. The sweeties and ice cold heineken was a well appreciated bonus aswell. The event in the evening proved to be a huge hit as not only was it a great networking opportunity for me but an awesome party as well.  I was advised that these functions were held to thank

This hotel has quite good rooms nice seafood try tiger prawns .. in the restaurant down and breakfat is nice also  and specially the staff is amazing meet kingsley the porter of the hotel he is the best man in the hotel and even in lagos !!

Extremly friendly staff. Good room layout. Exellent tigers prawns on the menue, which is a must try if you visit thesr hotel. Nice guest house size atmosphear.  Beatifuf small restaurant were u can eat next to the pool

Lovely hotel, clean and friendly.  Limited menu for dinner but breakfast buffet is very good.  I had an issue with my room which was sorted very quickly and very efficiently.  Staff are very attentive and friendly.  Will always stay here when on business in Lagos.

Really enjoy my stay each time.   Great service and always with a smile. Large variety of food served in a spectacular fashion.   Staff always friendly,  polite and go out of their way to help.  I will always come back.

That hotel has a soul. And its shown in every corner. Old books are placed on high shelves reaching up to the ceiling. Books are different and depending on your interests, select what you're interested in and read it while lying on a lounger by the pool. On Valentine's Day I got a red rose. So lovely gift! Thank you! The service is friendly and always ready to help.

I've been traveling to Lagos for 15 years and nothing can beat the Protea Leadway in Ikeja for personalised service, excellent food and location. All guaranteed by the personal attention to detail that the GM Dean Ogilvy and his team give. Don't bother trying anything else, but book early.

Review Title: One of best Hotels in Ikeja
Review Text: staying since more than 5 years at this hotel , for me ine of best in Ikeja Quit Place, good for relaxing, small but nice hotel. Very good Food at restaurant and staff is tranig their best service, if you have any complains they will help you, what ist Not Standard in something other hotels. I still like to come again to this Place  Who Looks for good and save Place downtown in Ikeja will find here in Maryland good hotel, also Roms are nice.  Everybody who likes it not too crowdy will like it
Review Text

I stayed here in January 2015 while I was in Lagos on business. This is a great little hotel, cool, calm, peaceful. Has everything you'd want. Really relaxing if you've been out in the city all day. All very clean and safe. Staff are friendly but not OTT. The lady who'd handled my booking came out from the office to meet me when I checked in, it felt like a little family run place where all the guests are really appreciated.    The only thing I'd mention - and it's not a negative at all, just something I hadn't realised - is how very small the hotel is. There's only one restaurant, which serves the same menu for lunch and dinner, so the food can get a bit monotonous if you're there for a few days. The food is very good though. There's also a snack bar menu with pizza etc which

I spent a night here in December 2014. I have done so before but didn't bother to review this place. The serene is ok, the room is nice. I love the vent spreading noiseless cold air into the room. The bed is soft and makes sleeping a paradise for dreamers......

It's a nice and cozy hotel with friendly and helpful staffs.. Room was quite big and clean.. Small size pool and restaurant.  The breakfast was not bad..   I would come back because of the hospitality of the hotel's staffs.  xx

Very very nice service, always polite and helpful. Delicious food in the hotel restaurant.. Although, internet connection in the room is reconnecting very often. But they do apologise for inconvenience and try to repair it.
Author Location: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Review Title: Probably The Best Protea Hotel  in Lagos
Review Text: 8.00pm Wednesday 17th December 2014  This is about my fourth visit to this hotel. One word to describe them 'impeccable'. I observed  the Emirates airline crew as they arrived from the airport and they were checked in. They kept saying 'Wao' as they took in the surroundings.  Obviously,  it was their first time of lodging there.  You cannot miss the impressive bookshelf at the Check-In counter. I have not seen it's kind in Nigeria. The room is spacious and the bath tub and bathroom area is unique. It was my first time of visiting the pool area. The ambience in the evening is cool and calm. The hotel has ample parking space and effective security.   We ordered a plate of goat-meat peppersoup,  chicken salad and jolly rice with goat meat in stew. Everyone seems satisfied. I think

Review Title: nice concept of rooms, nice staff
Review Text: Rooms are very nicely designed, although a small upgrade woudn't harm anybody. just one thing, I coudlnt find trash basket anywhere in the room just in the toilet, which was quite weird and didng make much sense. Anyway, hotel is clean and staff very nice and polite. Outside pool is gorgeous and food there is fantastic!! Try the speciality - peri peri king prawns. They are huge and taste like piece of heaven.

I stayed for three nights at Protea Hotel Leadway in November, and it is really a home away from home. The management is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and well equiped, and the food is excellent.

The first time I stayed at this hotel was "by mistake"- I thought I was booking myself into the "other Protea" in GRA, and on arrival at Protea Leadway, wanted the driver to turn back and take me to GRA. But am I glad the driver coaxed me into staying! That was December 2013. To date, I have stayed at this hotel numerous times. The service is fantastic, the atmosphere cosy and intimate, you don't feel as though you are staying at a "hotel". The rooms are quite large, but also very comfortable - room service is fantastic, and the staff very friendly. On my second stay there, I inadvertently forgot my laptop in the dining room after a particularly long day of work, and one of the waiters kindly brought it to my room, and refused a tip! This is the kind of treatment that makes me

I have stayed at this hotel many many times and it is great.  Rooms are clean.  Service is friendly and good.  Food is good.  Never had a complaint.  Proximity to airport is most important.  I will always be back. An Oasis in Lagos.

I stayed at the property for 4days and with my partner and we had a comfortable and relaxing stay. We enjoyed the surroundings and found that the hotel staff were extremely attentive, professional as well as having a high level of customer service. On arrival we were placed on a 1st floor room, the next day I asked to change to a room on a higher floor (just my personal preference nothing was wrong with the room) and very quickly someone came to help us with our bags. The location of the hotel is also pretty good as its in Ikeja GRA which is a nice area on the mainland, and has plenty of restaurants (my favourite was yellow chilli for authentic Nigeria food) and also markets such as Opebi which are all in a easy commutable distance. The area offers a great alternative to staying
Review Text

I stayed in the Hotel for two nights, I found the Hotel to be relaxing and cosy, I had a good sleep. Internet was a bit frustrating as at kept on prompting me to log in but this is very common in Nigeria.  The reason I moved out to another hotel before my stay was over was just the fact that there are no smoking rooms and I have to keep going to the pool area in the rain.  Otherwise it is a great hotel, staff are very good, meals are well made and the price is good. Airport pick up and transport to my meetings with hotel driver was excellent.  I must also appreciate the the hotel is very prompt on replying emails and makes the booking very easy.  I would recommend it any time to travelers.

I would like to thank Dean the GM for the way he looks after our company. The facilities are fantastic. All our needs are taken care of with fantastic attention to detail. Keep up the great service and customer care

I was thrilled to learn that Protea had partnered with Marriott and this was my main reason for choosing to stay at Protea for my recent visit to Lagos, Nigeria.  I must admit that I did not have high expectations as I have stayed at several "Luxury" hotels in Nigeria only to be disappointed that was until my recent week at Protea.  This hotel wowed me with their great customer service from the front door to the front desk. Everyone went out of their way to make sure my accommodations were satisfactory as well as keeping my room clean daily.  I have never met a better more helpful staff doing my travels to different parts of Nigeria.    I was in a standard room that was very clean and temperature of water in shower was GREAT! Food in restaurant is a bit pricey but there are

I was at the protea leadway for 2 weeks and as always i had a very good stay over, the service, the food and the room was as close as possible to what i can get at home. i chose Leadway because the staff takes good care of my needs.  Being in Lagos for me safty is key and i can say that Protea makes me feel very safe.  I will be back to stay at Protea Leadway and will continue to stay there in the futur. Thank you Protea hotel. Bets regards

Rooms are large and comfortable with good facilities, in good condition.  Staff were very helpful and courteous and genuinely seemed pleased to see me.  Food in the restuarant is of excellent quality.  The management team took time to walk around the hotel from time to time and speak to the guests.

The staff and management of the hotel are helpful and accommodating, very nice menu and also professional waiters to attend to your needs, rooms are comfortable and clean at affordable prices, the hotels offers a quiet and enjoyable stay and furthermore, the hotel is located close to the airport.

Review Title: A High-Quality Hotel and an Oasis of Calm
Review Text: I stayed at the Protea Hotel Leadway with my husband in the week after our wedding. What we wanted the most was a cosy and comfortable room with excellent food. And that we got!  Our room was big and spacious and cool. The bed was heaven to lie in. And the food was excellent. There is just one restaurant, but the food is delicious and there is a nice variety to pick from. The staff also were attentive and courteous without being overbearing.  I have stayed in a lot of hotels, but mostly for work. It was a different experience to stay for pleasure and to spend so much time in the room. That I didn't get cabin fever or feel claustrophobic was really a testament to how welcoming and comfy the room was.  This hotel is really an oasis of calm, because parts of the surrounding area

It's my second time in this hotel, staff are welcoming, friendly and helpful, rooms clean, nice menu the food is a wow factor, it's cosy atmosphere  and above all excellent customer service, room service on time no delay, keep it up  all the way I would recommended  strongly this hotel.

My home fare from home is still the Protea Hotel Leadway. The very good level is still there. The new GM Dean keeps the pace from Ankia. The rooms are nice and specious. The kitchen fulfills our requirements. It is time to change the menu. The staff is great and looks after the guests. I can recommend the hotel to all business guests in Lagos.

It was my second visit to the Protea Hotel Leadway, Ikeja, Nigeria.  The hotel exceeded expectations and provides good service and tasty food.  It is a relaxing athmosphere will well thought out amenities.  The rooms are spacious and comfortable.  I can recommend this hotel to visitors going to Lagos, Nigeria.
Review Text

I have stayed in the hotel a couple of times and the experience has always been the same; very comforting. Nice bed, soft pillows, ready to help staff, nice restaurant & food. Quiet & serene ambience inspire of the hassle & bustle of Lagos. It's closeness to the airport is also a unique quality.

.i had an excellent stay the room is clean and homy  the food is good especially the tiger prawns, tammy.., the stuff are zoo friendly  they made feel special and so much comfortable.  love the hotel and the stuff

This was my second stay at the hotel and my avenge stay is 2 weeks at a time. I was really very impressed with the overall stay. Very friendly staff,  extremely comfortable rooms, good food. If you know Lagos you will know that there is only one thing that you want at the end of a long day and that is a well air conditioned room and this is just what you get. The whole hotel is well circulated with cool air.  I will surely revisit the hotel on my next visit.

I have been traveling and working in Nigeria for the past 2 years and have visited various hotels. The Protea Leadway is always one of our top choices when staying in Lagos. Very clean and nicely decorated rooms. A very friendly check in staff who only need to see you once and remember your name. A lovely little restaurant with a nicely appointed menu with tasty dishes. And if you have some time relax in the pool. Security is well taken care of with a gaurded gate and friendly security staff roaming the area making sure you are well looked after. All in all a lovely little hotel with everything you need to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable

I should admit that I do travel a lot and stay in various hotels. The most important aspect for me is the attitude of the staff and then the comfort and cleanliness. If I can have these three aspects I would definitely return. This is what I experienced in Protea Hotel Leadway.  The entire staff were friendly and had the willingness to help. They all had a smile when wishing you or greeting you whenever they saw you around the premises. The hotel may not claim to be very big with numerous restaurants, but they do an excellent job with what they have. The breakfast was just what you would expect in the morning. The rooms were comfortable with clean sheets and towels. The only draw back is there is not enough electric plug points/sockets around the room, which does not matter much

Stayed at the protea leadway for 6 years   Friendly staff great service and good value rooms which are well looked after.  Excellent restaurant and the Tiger Prawns best ever !!!!      Close to airport  and in a nice quiet location but just off the main road for east access.   The best I have stayed in !! Try it !!

This hotel was just lovely. The staff very great. I had an amazing time here. The food was awesome. It felt like home truly. Everyone smiles too.  Will still pick here if I have to stay in ikeja again.

I had a short visit here when I recently had to overnight in Lagos in between flights.  The hotel itself is quite small but is very quaint. It has a nice restaurant and pool area and the food is very good. Although pricey, the hotel rooms are quite clean, comfortable, and inviting.   Although my room rate included breakfast, I had to leave at 5:00AM for the airport. Even though breakfast started at 5:30AM they were not flexible to even allow me to take someone small (like a piece of fruit) from the breakfast room. This was the one disappointment about this hotel.

Single night stay between flights.  A small comfortable hotel near the airport with friendly, helpful staff and a nice bar/restaurant.  Food is good, particularly the Hamburger!  The small pool is clean and inviting. Gym is small with limited equipment and a little too humid.  Room was clean and quite comfortable.  Bath room a little tired but perfectly acceptable.  No complaints at all.

By mere chance or fate, we had to leave Cairo for home (Nigeria rather than Dubai as this was our planned destination for Christmas holidays) and wanted to try another hotel rather than Southern sun and most importantly wanted to stay centrally on the mainland. So Protea Hotel leadway was the choice for me.  Where do i start?  Booking process? - Seamless, thanks to Idowu Egbo (the reservation manager, i guess)  Check-in? Remarkably fast and virtually flawless.   The room? - African touch blended with modern features.   Ambiance? - Its a small hotel with a very pleasant ambiance. The Christmas decorations added a very homely feel  Staffs? - All smiles (real smiles not forced ones) and everyone ready to help make your stay as pleasant as possible. I asked for an extra bed for my
Review Text

It was a weekend stay with family for a break and it was value for money, I must confess though. Location is slightly removed tucked in an residential estate away from the noise pollution associated with typical Lagos environment, and security was excellent. Facilities in and around the rooms are just average though the claim of 'fast' internet service was a mirage but it could be claimed on the environment. Its a place to recommend to friends who won't mind paying for good service

Comfortable and secure hotel, located close to the airport. Spacious rooms, comfortable beds, the outdoor pool area is small but comfortable and has tables for dining outdoors. Restaurant/bar serves good food, although it is a little expensive. Staff are knowledgeable and friendly, an enjoyable stay!

This is another hotel from the Protea chain of hotels, located 15 mins from the airport. Comfortable large beds decent sized rooms. Bathrooms are reasonable with seperate shower and bath. Free intenet access but download speeds are slow due to ISP. A small pool with a sun deck. A small bar, dining room area and lounge area. Food menu is fixed but good quality, breakfast is plentyful, with a good choice. Security is provided and is apparent.

My husband and I live in Abuja and travel via Lagos to SA and this hotel is the only place we stay at. The staff are friendly and competent, the service is good and the rooms are always perfect (their beds are awesome). The GM there is very friendly and she will assist wherever she can. If you need somewhere not too far from the airport this is it! Safe travels.
Expensive but what isn't when in Africa om buisness. Good rooms, great connectivity (free) and excellent food makes this a very good place to stay in Nigeria

Review Title: THE place to be, in Lagos
Review Text: It might be boring to read, but in the past, when one stayed in Lagos, there was one hotel on the mainland and one on the islands. That is, internationally acceptable, hotels. Well they were and are exhorbitant expenisive and though renovated etc. still quite hopeless, especially the Libanese/state run Eko. Now a few more hotels have come up, quite a few to say all.  Of the RSA Protea group, there is ( in Lagos) the Ikeya one, which is OK, the VI one ( Victoria  island) , which is terrible, and badly run by a combination of Protea and owners management ( the worst), there is another one on VI ( Kuramo), well hidden but also always full, and the Westwood, but do not like the locatrion,as well as the one in Lekki, but that is any way to avoid because of teh Lekki Jam. And then

I recently had to travel to Lagos, Nigeria on business and was shocked at the prices of hotels in this city. I found the Protea Hotel Leadway online and the Tripadvisor reviews seemed good so I booked it.  I was very impressed - the security, the room, the bathroom, the free high speed wifi and the quality of restaurant food were all excellent. The staff were very friendly and accommodating - from the breakfast chef who asked me every morning if I had a good sleep to the duty manager that went out of his way to accommodate me when I needed some help. Lagos has huge electricity shortages so life runs on generators - fortunately they are very good at the hotel and despite a few seconds of blackout now and then you wouldn't even notice.   Ikeja is out of the "downtown" city which I

Hotel was Nice, staff was friendly. Brakefast everage, orange juice was nothing natural.  You feel safe in there, it's clean and the staff is friendly. Espensiv place to stay. The hotel is very quiete, don't expect to meet anybody at night at the bar... food was good! free internet and newspaper in the room!

I liked: clean room clean sheets warm welcome nice food free internet I didn't like: room overpriced (400â‚¬/night) food extremely overpriced (breakfast buffet = 25â‚¬)  Considering the other hotels in Lagos, I will definitley return to this hotel

Hotel quality was fine, but be careful of the hidden charges. We were charged an extra night because we checked in before 2pm!!! Even the duty manager refused to compromise. Our laundry took 48 hours and a lot of chasing to get back on a "Same day service". No hot water on the first day. The cost of food and drinks are horrendous. A bottle of water was N 800 (about 3.2 British pounds)
Review Text

Review Title: It's not great, but it's the best there is
Review Text: You don't (unless you are a masochist) go to Nigeria as a tourist. If you're here, you have a reason to be here and you are prepared to put up with the discomfort, the ugliness and all the other problems. So, if you have to be here, where do you stay? All the hotels in Lagos are overpriced by world standards and none of them is special. The Protea Leadway is the best of the bunch. The rooms are comfortable and clean (no bugs). The menu is limited but not bad. The service is friendly and as professional as you would expect from Protea trained staff. Security (very important in Lagos) is very good. Take lots of small denomination US dollar bills -- they're accepted with delight as tips and if you take any leftover Nigerian currency out of the country it will be worthless -- you

Currently staying at the Portea, leaving tomorrow.  Had a pretty confusing time selecting the right hotel in Lagos.  The reviews however, definitely helped.  Hence, writing my own. Have stayed at the Sheraton and the Victoria crown plaza before, but this hotel is so much better than these other over-rated hotels.  A little over-priced for Lagos, but still cheaper than most of the competitors. Very secure.  Great service.  From the security guard outside, all the way up to the manager, the staff is extremely personable and helpful.  The manager, a South African lady, went out of her way to arrange an excursion for me.   The breakfast buffet is decent.  Nothing extravagant, but very clean and reasonably choiced.   Rooms are very nice.  If anyone has stayed at the 987 Prague, the

I have travelled to Nigeria several times on business since 2005.  In the past I have stayed at the Protea Oakwood Park on the Lekki Peninsula.  However, this trip a colleague and I were just spending a couple of nights in Lagos on our way to/from Liberia, so we were looking for a nice, secure, comfortable hotel near the airport.  I had heard that Protea had a new hotel near the Sheraton, not too far from the airport, so we decided to give it a try.  we were definitely impressed with the quality boutique style hotel.  Unlike the larger Sheraton, the Protea Leadway is a 30plus room hotel with cozy restaurant bar with quality amenities, the rooms are all beautifully designed and some of the nicest amenities I have seen in West African hotels (hardwood floors, marble, flat screen
best hotel in lagos; affordable, first class treatment; nice food,jovial workers,neat and tidy; cant ask for more!!!! all i can say is its simply the best.

Review Title: Lagos Mainland now has 5 star accomodation !!
Review Text: I have been travelling to Lagos, Nigeria for many years. Until now, one of the few options on the mainland of Lagos has been the Sheraton Hotel. Unfortunately the Sheraton (and Eko on Victoria Island) have outrageous rooms rates and give little in return. It is sad to see that little or none of the revenue from these two hotels is put back into the business.   I was thrilled this week to discover a brand new hotel (2 months old) near the Sheraton. It is the Protea Leadway in Maryland, Lagos. This hotel would not be out of place in cities such as London and it deserves 5 stars. Those 5 stars are earned by   - reasonable rates - high calibre of staff who are attentive and pleasant to deal with - good menu and restaurant - quiet location - first class facilities and rooms - smaller
